name: Karina Varela
title: JakartaEE Ambassador | Co-founder, Automating & Architecting for Enterprises. Open Source++
bio:
Karina is a tech company co-founder, published author, JakartaEE Ambassador, Red Hat Champion, and international speaker with a strong presence in the Java and open source ecosystem.

Over more than a decade, she has helped shape, evolve, and position enterprise-grade technologies worldwide‚Äîleading high-impact initiatives at the world's largest open source company and one of the top global tech giants.

She is a frequent speaker at major technology conferences around the world and is widely recognized for her technical authority and sharp communication. Karina also leads SouJava Brazil and SouJava Brasilia, two of the most prominent Java communities globally.

name: Max Arruda
title: Senior IT Engineer Analyst | Developer Advocate ü•ë | Jakarta EE Ambassador | Jakarta NoSQL Committer | Oracle ACE Associate | SouJava JUG leader ‚òïÔ∏è | Open-source contributor | Streamer, Speaker and Article writerüé§üìÑ
bio:
Maximillian has been involved with software development since 2003. He is a Software Engineer, Developer Advocate, open-source enthusiast, Committer of the Jakarta NoSQL specification and Eclipse JNoSQL project, the latter of which is an implementation of the Jakarta NoSQL and Jakarta Data specifications. Maximillian is also a Jakarta EE Contributor and Ambassador.

Maximillian is also a JUG leader at SouJava (The Java Users Society), one of the world's largest Java User Groups Community, and an Oracle ACE Associate. His international speaking experience includes: Jakarta Tech Talks; GeeCON 2023 Prague; EclipseCON 2023 Germany; Oracle DevLive SP 2024 and GeeCON 2024 Krak√≥w.

Maximillian enjoys learning and helping developers by organizing, participating, and speaking at tech events and meetup community events. Besides liking tech stuff, he loves martial arts, especially Shotokan Karate - he is 1st DAN level and teaches in the school that his association is part of. He follows the 'family first' philosophy! He highly enjoys playing video games with his sons: Pietro and Giulliano. Of course, he loves standing with his wife: Maira.

name: Ot√°vio Santana
title: Software Engineer | Software Architect | Speaker | Writer | Book Author | Consultant | Staff Engineer | Mentor | Open Source Committer | Java Champion üíª üöÄ
bio:
I am Otavio. I have made significant contributions to the Java and open-source ecosystems. Since Java 8, I have helped shape the direction and objectives of the Java platform as a member of the JCP Executive Committee. Additionally, I serve as a committer and leader in several open-source projects and specifications.

Recognized for my impactful work, I have received numerous accolades, including all categories of the JCP Awards and the Duke's Choice Award. I am also a distinguished Java Champion and a member of the Oracle ACE program.

Beyond technology, I am an enthusiast for history and the economy. I love traveling, programming, and learning languages. I speak Portuguese, English, Spanish, Italian, and French fluently and have a particular talent for dad jokes.

name: Maur√≠cio Salatino
title: OSS & Ecosystem Engineer @Diagrid @Dapr @DaprDev - Java Champion - Platform Engineering on Kubernetes Author
bio:
I am Mauricio Salatino, also known as @salaboy, and I am passionate about Open Source, Kubernetes, and Cloud-Native software. I still consider myself a developer at heart.

I am an Open Source & Ecosystem Software Engineer at @Diagrid, contributing to and driving initiatives for the Dapr OSS project. I also serve as a Steering Committee member for the Knative Project, and I am Co-Leading the Knative Functions initiative. I am serving as a co-chair of the TAG AppDelivery Application Development working group for the CNCF.

I also wrote a book titled Platform Engineering on Kubernetes for Manning. I previously worked at VMware and Red Hat, building tools to help developers be more productive.
